Description: Head of M. Antonius right, bearded. Border of dots. (obverse)
Fortuna standing left, holding Victory in right hand and cornucopia in left hand; behind, inscription; before, inscription. Border of dots. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Republic Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Republic
Curator's comments: Produced at Rome, this portrait of Antony is in a fine, monumental style.
Bibliographic references: RR1 / Coins of the Roman Republic in the British Museum: vol. 1 aes rude, aes signatum, aes grave, and coinage of Rome from B.C. 268. (4294, p.588)
Walker & Higgs 2001 / Cleopatra of Egypt: from History to Myth (238)
Ghey, Leins & Crawford 2010 / A catalogue of the Roman Republican Coins in the British Museum, with descriptions and chronology based on M.H. Crawford, Roman Republican Coinage (1974) (494.32.2)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
